duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform patient reception, scheduling, and financial pre-clearance functions to ensure patient satisfaction and maximum reimbursement.
Update patient insurance and demographic information and enter it into the practice management system.
Answer phones, schedule appointments, and contact patients to confirm scheduled and canceled appointments.
Check in patients, verify demographics, and complete financial screening.
Collect co-pays and enter payments from patients.
Facilitate prior authorization for diagnostic testing and review waiting room status.
Ensure prior approval and other required procedures are met prior to the delivery of care.
Reconcile daily patient schedule and review encounters that may require correction.
Scan documents into the practice management system on a daily basis.
Participate in system development and process improvement by providing feedback to management.
Follow all HIPAA and other federal/state agency requirements regarding proper handling of PHI documents.

education_certification.credential: HS/GED; Associates degree preferred. Minimum of one week training on-site provided by practice. Preferred: experience in a medical office setting, utilizing a computer system for physician scheduling
